p: In addition to offering a second application for certain licensed antivirals that directly target viral replication, radionuclide imaging may also provide a use for some compounds that are active in vitro and in animal models, but for various reasons have not moved forward to licensure. As in the case of deoxyglucose, which failed in trials as a cancer drug, but is now the most widely used tracer for PET imaging, this might include candidate antivirals that are nephro- or hepatotoxic at therapeutic doses. Rather than discarding such drugs, researchers should consider evaluating them for use as virus-specific imaging probes.
